summary: E-commerce saree shop with admin panel. User is experiencing issues adding sarees in the admin panel (timeout/error). Fix involves image compression, better error handling, optimized storage, and retry logic.
architectural_notes: Backend runs on Internet Computer (ICP) canisters with ~2MB per-call message size limit
Saree image uploads must be compressed to under 1-2MB to avoid timeout errors
known_issues: Admin panel saree upload times out and shows 'can't add, try again' error â€” likely due to large image files or canister memory limits

existing_features.title: Add client-side image compression in the AdminSarees upload form before sending image data to the backend. Compress images to ensure they stay within the Internet Computer's ~2MB message size limit. Show the user the compressed file size before submission.
Add a visible upload progress indicator and loading state in the AdminSarees add/edit modal so users know the upload is in progress and do not click submit multiple times.

Add automatic retry logic (up to 3 attempts with exponential backoff) to the saree add/update mutation in the AdminSarees page. If all retries fail, display a specific error message describing the likely cause (e.g., image too large, network timeout) rather than a generic 'try again' message.

new_feature_requests.summary: Fix admin panel saree upload: add image compression, retry logic, better error messages, and optimized backend storage

Optimize the backend saree storage in backend/main.mo to store image data as a Blob or chunked format if necessary, and ensure the addSaree and updateSaree methods handle large payloads gracefully by returning a descriptive error variant instead of trapping.
